text: I need to be able to reference the list of blog topics and/or authors for a specific blog and populate into a select input for filters. I’ve tried post_filter but with that I can’t filter the content by _both_ the topic and the author, just one or the other. Unless I’m missing something. My next step is to look at using the API, but I feel like there should be an easier way to do this since it’s all within the same HubSpot blog. Any thoughts?

Hello everyone, I am working on a module to show a certain number of posts with a particular tag from a certain blog. When I try to create a field so that I could select say the 'tag' and replace 'tag-name' with the snippet it comes up as an error. Can anyone help me with why this is?    % set posts = blog_recent_topic_posts('blog-selection', 'tag-name', 3) %} to % set posts = blog_recent_topic_posts('blog-selection', {{ snippet }}, 3) %}
well just in-case you didn’t just make a copy and paste error there’s no starting bracket
```{% set posts = blog_recent_topic_posts('blog-selection', 'tag-name', 3) %} to % set posts = blog_recent_topic_posts('blog-selection', blog_tag_variable_without_brackets, 3) %}```
You may have to also set a default blog tag topic or detect if one is set, else don’t set posts to this, because it will error
Is there a parameter that I could pass here to run a script on successful submission?
have to use the javascript embed for that
you can still use the field in the custom module
you just use that to enter the id, and populate the embed script stuff
